title: torrent
sections: A torrent of water swept down the valley.
(話語等的) 連發；(感情等的) 迸發；狂潮 [S1]
His answer was a torrent of abuses.
他的回答是連珠砲式的漫罵。

title: integral
sections: 構成整體所必需的，不可缺的 [（+to）]
The arms and legs are integral parts of a human body.
臂和腿是人體不可缺少的部分。

title: procure
sections: (努力) 取得，獲得；採辦；為……獲得 [（+for）] [O1]
This kind of original painting is hard to procure.
這種油畫的原作是不易弄到的。
The traitors procured the death of the prince.
賣國賊導致了王子之死。
The two parties procured a temporary agreement.

title: renounce
sections: He renounced his claim to the inheritance.
他聲明放棄對遺產的要求。
與……斷絕關係，拒絕承認（子女等）
It was painful for him to renounce his son.
宣布與兒子脫離關係對他來說是很痛苦的。

title: defer
sections: She has made up her mind to defer her departure for two days.
她決定將行程推遲兩天。
His military service was deferred until he finished college.
他去軍隊服役被推遲到念完大學。

title: temperate
sections: He is a temperate man, and never drinks too much.
他是一個有節制的人，從不過量飲酒。
I love the temperate climate here.
我喜歡這兒溫和的氣候。

title: utmost
sections: We walked to the utmost edge of the woods.
我們走到林子的最邊緣。
Conservation is of the utmost importance.
保護自然資源至關重要。
極限；極度；最大可能 [the S]
They have done their utmost to learn the techniques of production.
他們盡了最大努力去學習生產技術。

title: shabby
sections: An old man in shabby clothes came to the door.
一位衣衫襤褸的老人來到門前。
It's shabby to speak ill of others behind their backs.
在背後講人壞話是卑鄙的。
Strangers get such shabby treatment in this town that they never want to visit it again.
陌生人在這個城裡遇到如此怠慢的對待，以至於沒有人會再度訪問它。
His reasoning is weak, even shabby.
他的論證軟弱無力，甚至可以說很拙劣。

title: idiot
sections: He was an idiot to lose his glasses.
他是個糊塗蟲把自己的眼鏡也丟了。

title: certify
sections: Two witnesses must certify that this is your signature.
須有兩個見證人證明這確是你的簽字。

title: grin
sections: She grinned her appreciation of my help.
她露齒一笑表示感激我的幫助。
He had a broad grin on his face.

title: waterfall
sections: The river came pouring down in a waterfall off the hill.
河水從山上傾瀉而下形成瀑布。

title: symmetry
sections: The need to incorporate a staircase prevented perfect symmetry.
因為需要加進一個樓梯，就不可能完全對稱了。

title: condense
sections: Milk becomes condensed when water is taken out of it.
去除其中的水分，牛奶便成煉乳。
He condensed his report from 2,000 words to 1,000.
他將報告從兩千字壓縮到一千字。
(氣體) 冷卻成液體（或固體）
Moisture in the atmosphere condensed into dew during the night.
大氣中的水汽在夜裡凝成了露水。

title: paralysis
sections: The accident left him with paralysis of the legs.

title: menace
sections: He spoke with menace in his voice.
他說話的聲音中帶著威脅。
威脅性的言行；具有危害性的人（或物） [C]
These local conflicts may constitute a menace to world peace.
這些地方性的衝突有可能對世界和平構成威脅。
【口語】 極端討厭的人（或物） [C]
The robber menaced him with a revolver.
強盜用左輪手槍威嚇他。

title: ascertain
sections: Can you ascertain who he is?
你能否查明他是何許人？
We ascertained that he was dead.

title: wail
sections: The child started to wail when the nurse came over with a syringe.
當護士拿著針筒走過來時，孩子便嚎啕大哭起來。
(風等) 呼嘯；(警笛等) 尖嘯
The wind wailed in the trees.
They are still wailing over their defeat.
他們仍在為比賽失利而悲歎。
"He's taken my apple, mummy," she wailed. "媽媽，他搶走了我的蘋果，"她哭著說。
Newborn babies begin their life with a wail.
新生兒痛哭一聲便開始了他們的生命。
There was a plaintive wail from the sofa: "What about me?"
沙發上傳來傷心的嗚咽聲："那我呢？"

title: embody
sections: The Statue of Liberty embodies the spirit of freedom.
自由女神像體現了熱愛自由的精神。
The experiments of ten scientists were embodied in the report.
十位科學家的試驗情況收入了那份報告。

title: pluck
sections: 他摘了一朵玫瑰花給她。
He plucked the letter from her hands.
他從她手裡把信抓了過來。
The brambles plucked at her skirt.
She plucked at the loose threads of her coat.
她扯去上衣上鬆了的線。
With a few plucks at the strings of his banjo, everybody was singing along.
他撥了撥班卓琴的琴弦，每個人就都跟著唱了起了。
He showed pluck in fighting a boy much bigger than himself.
他敢於跟一個比他大得多的孩子搏鬥，足以表現出他的勇氣。

title: burglar
sections: Burglars broke into his house last night.
昨天夜裡竊賊闖入他家。

title: flutter
sections: The flag fluttered in the breeze.
The young bird fluttered its wings.
That TV play caused a mild flutter among the viewers.
那齣電視劇在觀眾中稍稍引起轟動。

title: induct
sections: The purpose of the orientation is to induct the new students into the university.
新生訓練的目的就是要引導新的學生進入大學。

title: languish
sections: We all languished in the tropical climate.
受熱帶氣候影響，我們都變得倦怠乏力。
He languished in poverty most of his life.
他大半輩子在貧窮中呻吟。
She languished for her children who had migrated to Australia.
她苦苦思念著移居澳大利亞的兒女。

title: cruise
sections: The coastguard cutter cruised along the coast looking for smugglers.
海岸警衛隊緝私艇沿海巡邏搜尋走私犯。
(計程車，警車等) 緩慢巡行
The taxi was cruising down the street in search of passengers.
計程車沿大街緩慢地行駛以兜攬顧客。
The police car cruised the neighborhood.
I saw several boys cruising the street.
我看見幾個男孩徘徊於街頭。
The liner is making a round-the-world cruise.

title: herd
sections: We saw a herd of elephants yesterday.
昨天我們見到了一群大象。
Dogs are often trained to herd sheep.
The chained people were herded back into the dark cellar.
那些帶了鎖鏈的人被一起趕回到黑暗的地窖。

title: waterproof
sections: Put on your waterproofs. It's going to rain.
穿上你的雨衣。天要下雨了。
使不透水，使防水；把……上膠
The company will come up with a new technique for waterproofing walls.
該公司將推出防止牆壁滲水的新技術。

title: surpass
sections: She surpassed her brother in mathematics.
她在數學方面超過了她的兄弟。
他的成功令人難以置信。

title: yawn
sections: He stretched himself with a yawn.
他打了個呵欠伸了伸懶腰。
The play was a big yawn from start to finish.
那齣戲從頭至尾極其乏味。
Mr. Walsh yawned over the evening papers.
華爾希先生一邊看晚報一邊打呵欠。
A big gap yawned between the rocks.
岩石間豁開一個大裂口。
The old man yawned a reply.

title: stew
sections: We stewed the tomatoes with peppers.
She was so stewed up with anxiety that she couldn't sleep.
她焦急萬分，覺也睡不著。
She is all in a stew over her lost suitcase.
她因丟失衣箱焦急萬分。
She has been stewing over this thing all night.
她為此事整夜坐臥不寧。
We had beef stew for lunch.

title: den
sections: The bear's den was in a cave.
這熊的窩是在一個洞穴裡。
幽靜小巧的私室（或書齋）
He enjoys reading in his den.
他喜歡在他的幽靜小巧的書房裡看書。

title: parasite
sections: The lazy man was a parasite on his family.
那懶漢是他家的一個寄生蟲。

title: huddle
sections: The children huddled together like a flock of sheep.
那些孩子像一群羊一樣擠在一起。
【口語】 (私下) 開會；(暗中) 碰頭
They huddled to discuss the matter.
他們私下碰頭討論這件事。
Don't huddle all the boxes into one cupboard.
不要把所有的盒子都塞入一個櫥內。
The old man lay huddled up in bed.
老人躺在床上，縮成一團。
雜亂的一團（或一堆，一群）
There was a huddle of people around the injured man.
有雜亂的一群人圍著受傷的人。

title: vapor
sections: A cloud is a mass of vapor in the sky.
雲是天空中的一團水汽。
What amazing vapors a lonely man may get into his head!
一個寂寞的人腦子裡會產生多麼令人驚異的幻想啊！
They have hysterics, they weep, they have the vapors.
他們歇斯底里，他們哭泣，他們精神憂鬱。
Water vapors in the hot sun.
水在炎熱的陽光下汽化。

title: gallant
sections: The garden was made gallant with tulips.
花園裡種著郁金香顯得氣派不凡。
英勇的；騎士風度的，豪俠的
They are one of the most gallant peoples in the world.
他們是世界上最勇敢的民族之一。
Gallants gambled away a fortune at a sitting.
時髦男士們一次賭博就要輸掉一大筆錢。

title: undo
sections: 解開，打開；使鬆開；脫去（衣服等）
取消，消除；使失敗；使復舊
破壞，敗壞（成果、名譽等）；毀滅 [H]
He has undone the good work of his predecessor.
他已毀了他前任取得的良好成就。

title: twinkle
sections: The stars twinkled in the sky.
The diamond on her finger twinkled in the fire-light.
她手指上戴的鑽石在火光下閃閃發亮。
她一雙眼睛閃爍著喜悅的光芒。
(舞蹈者的雙腳) 輕快地移動
舞蹈演員的腳在輕快地移動。
There was not a star to twinkle hope and light to him.
沒有一顆星星向他閃爍希望與光明。
The twinkle of distant town lights was very beautiful.
遠處城鎮燈火閃爍，煞是好看。
There was a mischievous twinkle in his eyes.
他眼睛裡露出淘氣的神色。
The incident was over in a twinkle.
那件事一瞬間就過去了。

title: cram
sections: The hungry children crammed food down their throats.
那些飢餓的兒童狼吞虎嚥地吃著。
【口語】 (為應考) 死記硬背功課 [（+up/for）]
She crammed for her history exam.
她為應付歷史考試而臨時抱佛腳。
There was such a cram in the church.

title: vulgar
sections: Spitting in public is considered vulgar.
當眾吐痰被認為是粗鄙的行為。
The vice premier led a vulgar life in his hometown after he resigned.
那位副總理辭職後在故鄉過著平民生活。
通俗語的；鄉土語的，方言的
His father still speaks the vulgar language of the country.
他父親還是講鄉下的土語。
【古語】 庶民，平民百姓 [the S]
Nor was this the suspicion of the vulgar alone; it seems to have been shared by the clergy.
這也不單是庶民的懷疑；看來教士們也有同感。

title: panorama
sections: (不斷變化的) 一連串的景象（或事件）
Karen watched the panorama of passing people with wide eyes.
凱倫瞪著大眼觀看著一連串過往的人群。

title: usage
sections: The TV set was damaged from rough usage.
這架電視機由於使用太不小心而損壞了。
He is totally ignorant of social usage.
他對社會習俗一無所知。
"Do you have it?" is a common American usage, but it would be more likely for British speakers to say "Have you got it?" "Do you have it?"
是慣用的美語用法，而英國人很可能說"Have you got it?"。
【文學/文學用語】 慣用法；文法 [C] [U]
This is a book on modern English usage.
這是一本關於現代英語慣用法的書。

title: grudge
sections: 勉強地給；勉強地准許；不情願做 [v-ing] [+to-v] [O1]
At a time like this, I don't grudge a thing.
在這樣的時候，我什麼都捨得。
I don't hold any grudge against you.

title: undergraduate
sections: 大學生，大學肄業生[C]（以別於graduate研究生）
他是耶魯大學的大學生。
She had an undergraduate degree in psychology.
她有心理學的學士學位。

title: thaw
sections: (天氣) 變暖和（使冰雪融化）
天氣轉暖，冰雪融化很快。
變得隨和，變得不拘束，變得融洽
After a good dinner he began to thaw.
吃過一頓美餐後，他開始變得隨和了。
The sun soon thawed the ice on the river.
太陽很快融化了河上的冰層。
A cup of tea helped to thaw out our guest.
一杯茶有助於我們的客人變得不拘束。
融化，解凍；(態度，關係等) 緩和 [C] [S1]
The spring thaw often caused flooding.
春天解凍常常引起洪水泛濫。

title: sprout
sections: Fried bean sprouts is his favorite vegetable dish.
炒豆芽是他最喜歡吃的蔬菜。

title: pier
sections: (凸式) 碼頭，直碼頭；防波堤
He walked along the wooden pier and climbed down into the boat.
他沿著木碼頭走過去并爬上了船。

title: caste
sections: (印度社會的) 種姓；種姓制度 [U]
He came from the highest Hindu caste.
他出身印度最高的種姓。
(世襲的) 社會等級，社會集團；等級制度 [U]
I suppose you also have a caste system in your society.
我想你們的社會裡也有一種等級制度。

title: assassinate
sections: President Kennedy was assassinated in Dallas in 1963.
甘迺迪總統於一九六三在達拉斯遭暗殺。

title: twilight
sections: These animals begin the night's hunt at twilight.
這些動物在黃昏時分開始一夜的覓食。
衰退期；(人的) 暮年，晚期 [the S]
The old man is in the twilight of his career.
這老人已經進入了他生涯的晚期。
For three days the patient lay in a twilight of fever.
病人發燒整整三天，一直迷迷糊糊。
衰落時期的；暮年的，晚期的
The old man spent most of his twilight years working on his autobiography.
老人暮年的大部分時間都在寫他的自傳。

title: wane
sections: Don't be sad. The moon will become full after it wanes.
不要傷感。月缺以後會有滿月。
My interest in the problem waned.
我對那個問題的興趣減弱了。
When did the empire begin to wane?
那個帝國何時開始衰落的？
The moon is on the wane.
His fortune is on the wane.

title: radius
sections: 半徑；半徑距離；半徑範圍 [C] [the S] [（+of）]
There are three lakes within a radius of five miles.
周圍五英里之內有三個湖泊。
within the radius of one's experience

title: cardinal
sections: The speaker emphasized the cardinal importance of building a party to lead the country.
演講者強調了建立一個政黨來領導該國的根本重要性。
North, south, east, and west are the four cardinal points of the compass.
東、西、南、北是羅盤上的四個方位基點。
She is wearing a cardinal sweater today.
今天她穿了件鮮紅的毛衣。

title: nostalgia
sections: Seeing a school very much like the one I attended, I cannot but have a strong feeling of nostalgia.
看到與我讀過的非常相似的學校，我不禁興起一種懷舊之情。

title: bail
sections: He paid 5,000 dollars in bail for his son.
他繳了五千元保釋出他兒子。
保釋（某人）；(法官) 將（在押犯）交保釋放 [（+out）]
The lawyer bailed the prisoner out of jail.
My friends bailed me out with economic aid.
我的朋友們從經濟上幫助我使我脫離困境。

title: wag
sections: Their secret meetings set the villagers to wag their tongues.
他們祕密相會，使村民們議論紛紛。
搖，擺動，顫動；(動物) 搖尾巴
You must stop visiting that woman; tongues are beginning to wag.
你不能再去看望那女人了；人們已經議論紛紛了。
The dog greeted its master with a wag of its tail.

title: throb
sections: His heart throbbed at the good news.
聽到這好消息，他的心高興得直跳。
The drums seemed to throb in his ears.
陣陣鼓聲彷彿在他耳邊震響。
She felt her heart give a great throb.

title: loath
sections: He is loath to get out of bed on cold mornings.
在寒冷的早晨他討厭起床。

title: deadlock
sections: A compromise may break the deadlock between the union and management.
妥協也許能打破勞資雙方所處的僵局。
The negotiations reached a deadlock after two hours.
談判進行兩小時後便陷入僵局。
Pennsylvania produced the first of the game's two deadlocks at 5: 00 of the second quarter.
這次比賽出現兩次平局，在第二個四分之一場的第五分鐘賓州隊第一次將比分拉平。
The employer and strikers have been deadlocked for almost a week.
僱主與罷工工人已僵持了近一個星期。
Both handle and bolt are automatically deadlocked against turning.
把手和插銷都自動鎖死不能轉動。

title: cosmos
sections: (有和諧體系的) 宇宙 [the S]
Is there any other intelligent life elsewhere in the cosmos?
在宇宙的其他星球上還存在別的有智慧的生物嗎？

title: intangible
sections: 1 觸摸不到的；無形的，無實體的
Stocks and bonds are intangible property.
股票和證券是無形財產。
難以確定的，模糊的；難以理解的

title: paw
sections: Get your paws off those cakes.
別用你的手碰那些蛋糕。
The cat pawed the mouse it had caught.
貓用爪子抓它捉著的老鼠。
【口語】 笨拙地觸摸（或擺弄）；親暱地撫摸
The bull pawed the ground before charging.
公牛衝刺前用力拍打地面。
The dog pawed at the doorknob.
笨拙地觸摸；親暱地撫摸；翻找
He pawed frantically through the drawers.
他拼命翻找抽屜裡的東西。
Don't paw at everything you see.

title: reed
sections: We tried to avoid the beds of reeds at the river curves.
我們試圖避開河彎處的蘆葦灘。

title: artillery
sections: Heavy artillery fire caused great losses.
重砲轟擊造成了很大損失。

title: delinquent
sections: He is delinquent in paying his rent.
青少年罪犯；違法者；有過失者 [C]

title: lumber
sections: Piles of lumber were stacked along the road.
大量的木材堆放在路邊。
【美國英語 】 採伐……林木，伐（樹）
This valley was lumbered hard during the past decade.
在過去十年裡，這個山谷的林木被大肆採伐。
He refused to lumber himself with a family.
The house is lumbered up with useless articles.
這棟房子裡堆滿了沒用的物品。

title: sneeze
sections: Cole often emits a loud sneeze.
I caught a cold and sneezed a lot.
我得了感冒，老是打噴嚏。

title: morbid
sections: 一種疾病所致的贅生物
病態的；【口語】 憂鬱的
the morbid details of a story
故事中令人毛骨悚然的細節

title: coherent
sections: They seem to have no coherent plan for saving the company.
他們似乎沒有一個協調一致的挽救公司的計畫。
(話語等) 條理清楚的，連貫的

title: ebb
sections: They started sailing on the ebb.
The scandal brought his credibility to its lowest ebb.
那件醜聞使他的信譽跌到最低點。
Our hope of winning began to ebb in the third round.
比賽進入第三回合時我們打贏的希望變得渺茫了。

title: pageant
sections: 壯麗的場面；(常有彩車的) 盛裝遊行；慶典 [C]
The coronation of the new king was a splendid pageant.
新國王的加冕典禮是一個非常壯麗的場面。

title: verify
sections: It was easy to verify his statements.
Before the bank was willing to lend him money, it had to verify that he was the true owner of the house.
銀行先得核實他確是這幢房子的主人，然後才肯借錢給他。

title: acquit
sections: The jury acquitted her of all charges.
陪審團宣告她未犯所控諸項罪行。
He acquitted himself like a veteran.

title: cosmopolitan
sections: New York is a very cosmopolitan city.
世界主義的；無狹隘偏見的；四海為家的
She has a very cosmopolitan outlook on life.
她有四海一家的人生觀。
世界主義者；四海為家者

title: wholehearted
sections: 全心全意；全神貫注的；真摯的
He is a wholehearted friend of mine.

title: puff
sections: Are you happy fireworks are puffing all around?
四周都在放煙火你開心嗎？
The train puffed into the station.
They were puffing after climbing the hill.
Pike was puffing away at a cigarette nervously.
派克緊張不安地一口接一口抽著菸卷。
他那疼痛發炎的大拇指腫起來了。
一陣陣地吹（或噴）（空氣，塵土等）
The factory chimneys puffed dense smoke.
She puffed out the kerosene lamp.
The old man managed to puff out a few words.
那老人好容易喘著氣說出幾句話。
The boy puffed out his cheeks.
The miser was puffed as a philanthropist.
那個守財奴被說成是個慈善家。
He blew out three candles with a single puff.
他一口氣吹滅了三根蠟燭。
Puffs of steam and smoke came from the engine.
一股股蒸汽和煙霧從那火車頭裡冒出來。
The manager took a puff at his cigarette.
吹捧性的短文（或廣告等）；吹捧 [C] [U]
That commentary was just so much puff.
那篇評價文章盡是吹捧而已。

title: fervent
sections: She has a fervent desire to win.
她有著強烈的獲勝慾望。

title: kin
sections: He is no kin to me.
All our kin came to the family reunion.
我們的親屬全都參加了這次家庭團聚會。
有親屬關係的；同類的；類似的 [（+to）]
Your cousin is also kin to me.
你的堂兄也是我的親戚。

title: eject
sections: The police ejected the noisy group from the restaurant.
警察把那群吵鬧的人逐出了飯店。
They were ejected because they had not paid their rent.
他們因未付房租而被趕了出去。

title: vie
sections: All present vied to express their interest in the project.
在場的人都爭先恐後地表明自己對這個計畫的興趣。
They vied with one another for the trophy.

title: everlasting
sections: the everlasting snows of the mighty Himalayas
雄偉的喜馬拉雅山的終年積雪
I am tired of his everlasting complaints.
我厭倦了他不斷的抱怨。

title: salve
sections: It was a sort of salve to her conscience.
那對她的良心是一種寬慰。

title: abject
sections: He's anything but an abject coward.

title: latitude
sections: The two cities are at approximately the same latitude.
這兩個城市差不多位於同一緯度上。
(言語，行動等的) 迴旋餘地，自由 [U]
The boss gave me considerable latitude in this matter.
在處理這件事上老板給了我很大自由。
School rules allow the individual little latitude.
校規不容許個人恣意任行。

title: exasperate
sections: She was exasperated to find nobody at home.
她因發現沒人在家而生氣。
It exasperated me that they never kept their promises.
他們從不遵守諾言令我惱火。
I was exasperated by/at his stupidity.

title: velocity
sections: The hare darted off with the velocity of a bird.
野兔像鳥一樣快速掠去。
The velocity of light is about 186,000 miles per second.
光速大約是每秒十八萬六千英里。

title: beware
sections: Julius Caesar was advised to beware the eye of March before he was murdered.
凱撒大帝在被刺殺前就被警告說要謹防三月的眼睛（三月十五日）。
Beware how you handle the toxic chemical.
小心處理有毒的化學藥品。

title: imperative
sections: 1 必要的；緊急的；極重要的
It is imperative to act now.
命令式的；必須服從的；專橫的
他做了個命令式的手勢。
必須履行的責任；必要的事；需要 [C]
Job creation has become an imperative for the government.
創造就業機會成了政府必須做的事。

title: mangle
sections: 亂砍，亂撕；使受嚴重損傷 [H]
He was badly mangled in an automobile accident.
他在一次車禍中被壓得血肉模糊。

title: persevere
sections: In spite of all obstacles and failures, the scientist persevered with his experiments.
儘管阻力重重並屢遭失敗這位科學家還是堅持試驗。

title: annex
sections: An insurance policy was annexed to the contract.
合同上附加了保險條款。
The city annexed the area across the river.
該市合併了河對岸的地區。
She annexed the first prize in the speech contest.
她在演講比賽中獲得頭等獎。

title: daze
sections: The splendor of the palace dazed him.
王宮的富麗堂皇使他眼花繚亂。
She was dazed by the news.
The blow dazed me, but I wasn't hurt.
這一擊使我頭暈目眩，但我並未受傷。
He had been in a daze all the way to New York.
他去紐約途中一路恍惚。

title: serf
sections: The nobles had oppressed and exploited their serfs.

title: behold
sections: They beheld the night scene of the city.
他們看了那個城市的夜景。
Behold! What a beautiful sight it is!

title: feign
sections: 【文學/文學用語】 裝作，假裝 [+（that）]
He feigned that he was sick.
He feigned death to escape capture.

title: pebble
sections: The street was paved with pebbles.
We are going to pebble the walks in the park.
我們將用鵝卵石鋪公園裡的走道。
The boys teased the dog by pebbling it with acorns.
男孩子們用橡樹果打狗逗它玩。

title: serene
sections: She was always calm and serene.
He was gazing at the serene sky.

title: vicinity
sections: There is no high school in the vicinity.
The cost of the car is in the vicinity of 10,000 dollars.

title: plaintiff
sections: The plaintiff accused the defendant of fraud.

title: appendix
sections: Appendixes to a book are worth consulting.
He had his appendix removed last month because of appendicitis.
上個月他因患闌尾炎而切除了闌尾。
The book is indexed and appendixed.
這本書後有索引和附錄。

title: carpenter
sections: My father carpentered when he was young.
My uncle carpentered a table and a few stools for his needy neighbor.
我叔父給他窮困的鄰居做了一張桌子和幾隻凳子。

title: mercenary
sections: 1 為金錢的；圖利的；貪財的
His action was prompted by mercenary motives.
貪圖錢財的動機促使他採取行動。
(外國人的) 僱傭兵；受僱傭者

title: beset
sections: We were beset by mosquitoes in the swamp.
我們在沼澤地遭受蚊蟲圍攻。

title: ration
sections: The small ration of rice could hardly satisfy his hunger.
配給他的一點點米並不能使他免除飢餓。
【軍事】 (日需) 給養；(日需) 口糧 [P]
Food was rationed to the public during the war.
戰爭期間，食物限量供應給公眾。

title: wrinkle
sections: Her face was seamed with wrinkles.
It will take weeks to get all the wrinkles ironed out.
解決這些難題得要幾週時間。
She wrinkled her nose at the bad smell.
聞到臭氣，她皺起了鼻子。

title: audacious
sections: 敢於冒險的登山運動員
魯莽的；膽大妄為的，厚顏無恥的
It was audacious of him to try that.
他試圖做那種事，真是魯莽。

title: butcher
sections: 那個獨裁者大肆屠殺持異議的人。
He butchered the painting by spilling coffee over it.
他把咖啡濺在畫上，糟蹋了這幅圖。

title: intrinsic
sections: 1 本身的；本質的；固有的；內在的 [（+in/to）]
Equality is the intrinsic value of democracy. Without equality there can be no democracy.
平等是民主的根本價值。沒有平等，就沒有民主。
difficulties that are intrinsic to such a situation

title: jet
sections: The jet of water from the hose soon put out the fire.
救火水管中射出的水很快就把火撲滅了。
We are going to travel by jet.
我們打算乘噴射機旅行。
Oil suddenly jetted out of rig number four.
油突然從四號鑽井中噴了出來。

title: precipice
sections: He nearly fell off the precipice.
他差一點從懸崖上掉下去。
危急的處境；災難的邊緣
Britain was speeding towards an economic precipice.
英國正快速走向一場經濟災難。

title: beverage
sections: Beverages are not allowed in the school bus.

title: rapture
sections: She listened with rapture to the sweet music.
她著迷地聽著那美妙的音樂。
He fell into raptures over classic music.
他對古典音樂喜愛若狂。

title: caprice
sections: Her decision to wear only black clothes was pure caprice.
她決定只穿黑衣服完全是忽發奇想。

title: frigid
sections: Frigid winds blew from the north.
She returned his smile with a frigid glance.
對他的微笑她報以冷冷的一瞥。
She told her husband that she had been sexually frigid of late.
她跟她的丈夫說，她最近感到性冷感。

title: bulk
sections: A building of great bulk is to be erected across the road.
這條路對面將要建造一幢大樓。
大部分，主體，大多數 [the S] [（+of）]
The bulk of the railroad workers voted to go back to work.
大多數鐵路工人投票贊成恢復工作。
Sending bulk mails is entitled to some discount.
大宗郵件的寄送可以得到優惠。
(常後接large) 變得重要，顯得巨大
This test bulks large in his mind.
他覺得這一試驗很重要。

title: akin
sections: My friend's feelings are akin to mine.
我那位朋友的感受和我相近。
He is near akin to us.

title: gallop
sections: She went for a gallop after breakfast.
她吃完早飯騎著馬奔馳了一番。
We saw the horse gallop away as fast as he could.
我們看見那匹馬竭力奔馳而去。

title: abominable
sections: Murder is the most abominable crime.
謀殺是最可惡的犯罪行為。
【口語】 糟透的，極差的，惡劣的
The food in the cafeteria is abominable.
這家自助餐廳的膳食糟糕透了。

title: foe
sections: This is the most serious challenge from his political foe.
這是來自他政敵的最嚴重的挑戰。
Tobacco is a foe to health.

title: jeopardy
sections: The villagers' lives were in jeopardy during the blizzard.
暴風雪肆虐期間，村民們的生命處於危險之中。

title: parrot
sections: He talks like a parrot and just repeats what he heard.
他鸚鵡學舌，只是拾人牙慧。
鸚鵡學舌般地重複；機械地模仿
It's no use just parroting textbooks.
只是重複書本是沒有用的。

title: thatch
sections: The cottages are thatched with straw.
這些農舍均用稻草蓋頂。

title: emblem
sections: The cross is an emblem of Christianity.
十字架是基督教的象徵。
The eagle is the national emblem of the United States.

title: parlor
sections: She was lying on a small settee in the parlor.
她躺在客廳的一張小長椅上。

title: garbage
sections: 【美國英語 】 垃圾；剩菜；廢物
In her home, garbage was fed to the pigs.
He talked a lot of garbage on the subject.
關於這個問題，他講了許多廢話。

title: antidote
sections: He took an antidote for the poison.
他服了對付那種毒物的解毒劑。
【比喻】 對抗手段，矯正方法

title: fume
sections: (有害，濃烈，或難聞的) 煙，氣，汽 [P]
Tobacco fumes filled the air in the room.
室內的空氣中充滿了香菸的煙霧。
冒煙（或氣，汽）；(煙，汽等) 冒出

title: rake
sections: Father raked the soil smooth for a seed-bed.
父親耙平土壤做播種床。
The farmer raked the soybeans he was drying on the ground.
農夫把曬在地上的大豆耙攏。
The rescue team raked the area for a trace of lost travellers.
營救隊在這一地區仔細搜尋迷途旅人的蹤跡。
迅速（或大量）取得（錢財等） [（+in）]
The clouds raked the mountain summits.
He raked the horizon with a telescope.
他用望遠鏡掃視地平線。
I'll rake about among my papers and see if I can find it.
我將把我的文件好好翻檢一番，看能不能找到它。
The sea rakes against the shore.

title: skyscraper
sections: 摩天大樓擋住了我們的視線。

title: babble
sections: (嬰兒) 牙牙學語；模糊不清地說話
The babies babbled as they played.
嬰孩們一邊玩一邊咿咿呀呀地學說話。
She babbled a few words to him.
她對他說了幾句不知所雲的話。
He babbled the secret out to his friends.
他失口把祕密洩漏給朋友了。

title: crust
sections: The earth's crust is between 5 and 25 miles thick.
地殼有五至二十五英里厚。
He had the crust to ask to borrow my new car!
用硬皮覆蓋；在……上結硬皮

title: enchant
sections: The sorcerer enchanted the beautiful princess.
巫師使漂亮的公主中了魔法。
The family was enchanted with the cute little girl.
這一家子非常喜歡這個漂亮的小姑娘。
她把她所有的朋友都迷住了。

title: absolve
sections: They absolved her from the promise.
他們不再堅持要她履行諾言。

title: grope
sections: I groped for the light switch in the dark room.
我在黑洞洞的屋裡摸索著尋找電燈開關。
They are groping after the truth.
Then she blew out the candle and groped her way into bed.
然後她吹滅了蠟燭摸黑上床。

title: muster
sections: The troops were mustered for an attack.
部隊被集合起來發動進攻。
I mustered the courage to admit my mistake.
The platoon mustered for roll call.
There was a muster of all the guards.
全體衛兵進行了一次集合。

title: narcotic
sections: He was sent to prison on a narcotics charge.
他被指控販賣毒品而被關進監獄。

title: blurt
sections: (不加思索地) 衝口說出；不經意說出 [（+out）]
In his anger he blurted out the secret.
他在生氣時衝口說出了祕密。

title: feverish
sections: You're a bit feverish, you should go to bed.
你有點發燒，你該上床去。
They worked with feverish haste to finish the job.
為了完成此事他們以狂熱的速度工作著。

title: ripple
sections: The pebble made a ripple on the surface of the lake.
石子在湖面上激起一個漣漪。
(頭髮的) 波浪式；(衣裙的) 褶子 [C]
Her hair hung to her shoulders in soft ripples.
她的頭髮呈飄柔波浪式披懸到肩。
She lay on the bank, listening to the ripple of the stream.
她躺在河岸上，聽著小河的潺潺流水聲。
A ripple of laughter went through the audience.
觀眾中響起一陣輕輕的笑聲。
起漣漪；(頭髮等) 呈波狀
The water rippled over the stones.
A breeze rippled the water of the pond.

title: growl
sections: The coach growled at the players who were late.
教練對著遲到的運動員咆哮。
He growled a command to her to stop.
他咆哮著命令她停下來。

title: plateau
sections: They have been herding cattle on the plateau for generations.
他們世世代代在這高原上放牧。
(上升後的) 穩定水準（或時期）
In the seventies the U.S. space program seemed to have reached a plateau of development.
七十年代美國的宇宙空間計畫似乎發展到了一個較高的水準。

title: rinse
sections: After washing them in soapy water, rinse the clothes thoroughly.
衣服在肥皂水裡洗過之後，要徹底沖乾淨。
Rinse your mouth with warm water.
Rinse all the soap out of your hair after you wash it.
洗頭之後，將你頭髮上的肥皂全部沖洗乾淨。
What shall I drink to rinse the medicine down?
我喝什麼把這藥吞下去呢？
Give the plate a final rinse in cold water.
將餐具放在冷水裡最後沖洗一次。

title: blush
sections: She blushed at the mention of her lover's name.
她聽人提到她情人的名字，臉就紅了。
He blushed to admit that he had made a ridiculous mistake.
他慚愧地承認自己犯了個可笑的錯誤。
A blush came into his cheeks.
Light's last blushes tinged the distant hills.

title: souvenir
sections: She spent the morning buying souvenirs.

title: disdain
sections: I have nothing but disdain for such a person.
一個真正的男子漢鄙視諂媚者。
She disdained to answer/answering his rude remarks.

title: pawn
sections: His television set is in pawn to pay his rent.
他當了電視機以支付房租。

title: tickle
sections: He tickled the baby's feet and made her laugh.
他搔嬰兒的腳，把她逗笑了。
The clown tickled the audience with his funny actions.
小丑用滑稽動作逗觀眾發笑。
The self-esteem of the selected candidates was immediately tickled.
這立即激起了被挑選的候選人的自尊心。
My nose tickles from the dust and I want to scratch it.
我的鼻子受灰塵的刺激發癢，我很想搔它。
Pepper tickles if it gets into the nose.
胡椒弄到鼻孔裡會使人發癢。
The baby laughed when I gave her a tickle.

title: venomous
sections: They shot each other venomous glances.
他們惡狠狠地朝對方瞪眼。

title: adultery
sections: 有人控告他有通姦行為。

title: stammer
sections: The little child stammers in the presence of strangers.
那小孩在陌生人面前說話就結巴。
他結結巴巴地作了回答。

title: influx
sections: the influx of a river into the sea

title: commotion
sections: You're making a great commotion about nothing.
cause a commotion through the country

title: furrow
sections: The tractors have made deep furrows in the loose sand.
曳引機在鬆軟的沙土上留下了深深的車轍。
Care had caused deep furrows to appear on her forehead.
憂慮使她的前額上出現了深深的皺紋。
In spring, farmers are busy furrowing the fields.
The pain of the disease caused him habitually to furrow his brow.
病痛使他習慣性地緊皺眉頭。

title: affront
sections: It was an affront to common decency.
這是對社會禮儀的公然冒犯。

title: maternal
sections: She showed her daughter's picture with maternal pride.
她懷著作為母親的自豪感拿出女兒的照片給人看。

title: ballad
sections: Older people prefer ballads to pop music.
年紀大一些的人喜歡民歌，而不喜歡流行音樂。

title: self
sections: Much importance is attached to the development of the individual self.
十分重視個人自身的發展。
He never has any thought of self.

title: impair
sections: 疲勞削弱了他們的判斷力。
粗劣的食物損害了她的健康。

title: wholesome
sections: 1 合乎衛生的；有益健康的
牛奶是一種有益於健康的食品。
有益於身心健康的；有益的
Swimming is a wholesome pleasure to babies.
游泳對嬰兒是一種有益於身心健康的嬉戲活動。
健康的；強健的；生氣勃勃的
She has a clean, wholesome look.
This is not a wholesome situation.
這種局勢存在著潛在的危險。

title: flake
sections: Snow is falling in large flakes.
We watched the flakes of ice drift downstream.
我們看著薄冰層順流漂去。
The paint was flaking off the walls.

title: so
sections: 1 這麼，那麼；【口語】 多麼，非常
I'm so pleased to see you.
(so後用倒裝結構) 也如此，也一樣
I was tired, and so were the others.
I like dancing; so does my wife.
我喜歡跳舞，我太太也喜歡。
He is sturdy and so fit for the job.
他很健壯，所以適合擔任這個工作。
The manager was ill so I went in her place.
經理病了所以我代她去。
Mom told him to go to bed early so he could get up early the next morning.
媽媽叫他早點上床睡覺，第二天早上好早點起床。
So! You've kept me in the dark all the time.
哦！原來你一直把我蒙在鼓裡。

title: puppet
sections: 傀儡，受他人操縱的人（或集團）
Are we the puppets of fate?
我們都受命運的擺布嗎？

title: affinity
sections: Peter has a special affinity for booze.
(語言、生物等之間的) 類同；相像 [C] [（+to/with）]
Italian has a close affinity to French.
義大利語和法語很相似。
He felt a strong affinity to the Russian girl.
他深受那個俄國姑娘吸引。

title: glimmer
sections: A light glimmered at the end of the passage.
走廊的盡頭一盞燈閃爍著。
He can see a glimmer of light through the curtains.
他能透過窗簾看到一絲微光。

sections: She broomed up the scraps of paper.

title: equity
sections: They seem to be actuated by the principles of equity and justice.
看來他們受公平合理的原則所驅使。
When the existing laws fail to render a satisfactory judgment, equity applies.
當現存的法律不能作出令人滿意的判決時衡平法就生效。
They applied for a home equity loan to send their son to college.
為了送他們的兒子上大學他們申請了以房屋為抵押資產的貸款。
The company awards its employees with equities.
該公司以股票獎勵員工。

title: sled
sections: 【美國英語 】 雪橇；重型運輸雪橇
Sleds pulled by dogs are in common use in the Arctic.
狗拉的雪橇在北極地區很常用。
After it had stopped snowing, we all went sledding.
雪停之後，我們都去滑雪橇。
The logs were sledded out of the forest.

title: intoxicate
sections: How could she become intoxicated after only one glass of wine?
她只喝了一杯酒怎麼就醉了呢？
The prospect of success intoxicates me.

title: fetter
sections: He longed to escape from the fetters of an unhappy marriage.
他渴望逃脫那不幸婚姻的束縛。

title: surf
sections: If the waves are big enough, we'll go surfing.
如果浪夠大的話，我們就去衝浪。

title: rumple
sections: We could see from the rumpled sheets that the bed had been slept in.
我們從被弄縐的床單可以看出有人在這床上睡過了。

title: weigh
sections: He weighed the parcel by hand.
他用手掂一掂那一包包裹的重量。
They weighed the advantages and disadvantages before making the decision.
他們權衡利弊之後才作出決定。
重壓，把……壓彎；加過重負擔於
The branches of the pear tree were weighed heavily with fruit.
梨樹的樹枝給沉甸甸的果實壓彎了。
有分量，有重要性，有影響 [Q] [（+with）]
Her suggestion weighed heavily in this decision.
她的建議對作出這一決定起了重要作用。
The problem weighed on his mind.
那個問題沉重地壓在他心頭。

title: collateral
sections: A cousin is a collateral relative.
He used his house as a collateral for the loan.
他用房子作這筆貸款的擔保品。

title: oblique
sections: 轉彎抹角的，不直截了當的
She made an oblique reference to her own affairs.
她轉彎抹角地提起她自身的事。
躲躲閃閃的；不光明正大的
【语音/語言】 間接（格）的，斜（格）的 [Z]

title: butt
sections: Rest the butt of the rifle on the ground.

title: trot
sections: We set off at a trot.
【美國英語 】【俚語】 瀉肚子 [the P]
【美國英語 】【俚語】 (學生) 作弊夾帶的外文直譯本 [C]
A lazy student can dispense with the original and use the English text as a trot.
懶學生可以把原文拋在一邊而用英文直譯本。
(馬等) 小跑；(人) 騎馬小跑
The horses trotted around the circus ring.
The small boy trotted along after his brother.
小男孩跟在哥哥後面快步往前走。
Well, I must be trotting off home.
The driver trotted his horse down the road.
馬夫趕著他的馬沿大路小跑起來。
My father used to trot me down for a visit.
我父親過去常帶我去作客。
【口語】 老是提出；炫耀地出示 [（+out）]
Charles trotted out his little bit of scientific nomenclature.
查理斯炫耀他那點科學名詞。

title: cordial
sections: 熱忱的，友好的；衷心的；真摯的
The hostess gave us a cordial greeting.
女主人熱忱地歡迎我們。
咖啡是有興奮作用的飲料。

title: slumber
sections: He awoke from a deep slumber.
She gazed with affection at his slumbering form.
她深情地凝視著他那熟睡的身影。
那座火山正處於休眠狀態。
用睡眠打發；用睡眠消除 [（+away）]
He slumbered away a hot afternoon.
他以睡眠打發一個炎熱的下午。

title: shove
sections: Amy shoved the book across the desk to him.
艾咪把書推到書桌的另一邊給他。
He shoved his clothes into the drawer.
他將衣服胡亂塞進抽屜。
The surplus will shove the price down from a dollar to 60 cents.
剩餘貨物將會迫使價格從一美元跌到六十美分。
He shoved at the car but it wouldn't move.
他用力推車，但車子不動。
Everybody was pushing and shoving towards the exit.
大家都在推推搡搡向出口擠去。
The car won't start. Can you give it a shove?
這車子啟動不了。你能不能推它一把？

title: braid
sections: The uniform was trimmed with gold braid.
制服上鑲著金黃色的穗帶。
把（頭髮）編成辮子；把……編成穗帶
They wore their hair braided in long pigtails.
他們將頭髮梳成一條長辮子。
The girls are busy braiding rugs.

title: zest
sections: He entered into our plans with zest.
他熱心地加入我們的計畫。
The possibility of danger gave (a) zest to the adventure.
可能發生的危險增加了那次冒險的刺激性。
He felt that some of the zest had gone out of his life.
他覺得他的生活已少了些情趣。

title: redeem
sections: He redeemed his watch from pawn.
He redeemed his promise at last.
他終於履行了自己的諾言。
They hope the acting will redeem the play.
他們希望出色的表演能彌補戲本身的不足。

title: cactus
sections: There we could see nothing but cacti.
那裡除了仙人掌我們什麼也看不到。

title: hysterical
sections: They became hysterical after the accident.
事故發生後他們變得歇斯底里。
The movie was hysterical. I couldn't stop laughing.
那電影太滑稽了。我忍不住大笑。

title: goggle
sections: 他的眼珠熱切地轉動著。
This guy goggled at every young female passing by.
這傢伙瞪大眼睛看每一個走過的年輕女性。
His insincerity was revealed by the quick goggle of his eyes.
他眼睛的快速轉動泄露了他的不誠。
To disguise myself I put on a pair of big goggles and an old-fashioned dress.
為了偽裝自己，我戴上一副大太陽鏡並穿上一件老式連衣裙。
The child was amused by the goggle-eyed frogs.
這孩子覺得凸眼的青蛙很有趣。

title: censure
sections: The judge censured the driver but didn't fine him.
法官責備了司機但沒罰他款。
He received a public censure for his dishonourable behavior.
他因為不名譽的行為受到了公眾的譴責。

title: befall
sections: He was already sound asleep before the night befall.
在夜晚降臨之前，他就早已熟睡。
He fears bad luck may befall.

title: reclaim
sections: reclaim somebody from a life of vice

title: hypothesis
sections: People have proposed all sorts of hypotheses to explain why dinosaurs have become extinct.
人們提出種種假設，試圖說明恐龍為什麼會滅絕。

title: zenith
sections: It felt as if we had traveled from nadir to zenith.
感覺上我們好像已從天底走到了天頂。
Michael felt that he had already passed the zenith of his power.
麥克覺得自己的權力已過了頂盛期。
Being elected class president was the zenith of my years in high school.
當選級長是我中學時代最輝煌的時刻。

title: tumult
sections: The tumult in the streets awakened everyone in the house.
街上的喧嘩吵醒了屋子裡的每一個人。
(思想、情緒等的) 波動，激動
Her mind was in a tumult.

title: pouch
sections: The old man is always carrying a tobacco pouch with him.
這老漢總是隨身帶著煙袋。
A kangaroo carries its young in a pouch.
大袋鼠以肚袋裝小袋鼠。
He has pouches under his eyes.
他的眼睛下面垂著眼袋。
The mail was sorted and pouched by midnight.
郵件在午夜前分揀裝包。

title: cleavage
sections: a sharp cleavage in society between rich and poor

title: roundabout
sections: 1 繞道的；(說話，做事等) 繞圈子的，不直截了當的
As usual, he reached her house in a roundabout way.
一如往常，他繞道來到她的家。
She suggested it in a very roundabout way.
她很婉轉地提出了這個建議。

title: sever
sections: His arm was severed from the body in the accident.
在這一事故中他的一條手臂被從身上割斷下來。
She had to sever all ties with her parents.
她不得不斷絕與父母的一切聯繫。

title: kindle
sections: She kindled a fire with waste newspaper.
The speaker kindled our interest in dinosaurs.
那位演講人引起了我們對恐龍的興趣。
The paper kindled on the second match.
劃了第二根火柴，紙就點著了。
她的眼睛因喜悅而發亮。

title: pavilion
sections: They are looking around the Japanese pavilion.
他們正在參觀日本展示館。

title: camouflage
sections: They covered their tanks with leaves and branches as camouflage.
他們用樹枝和樹葉將坦克偽裝起來。
偽裝物；掩飾手段；保護色
Some insects have a natural camouflage which hides them from the attack of their enemies.
有些昆蟲有一種天然的保護色可以防止敵人的襲擊。
他的士兵們已很好地隱蔽起來。

title: banner
sections: John carried our school banner in the parade.
約翰在遊行時舉著我們的校旗。
(張掛在街頭或遊行隊伍等用的) 橫幅
Welcoming banners hung from the balcony.
陽臺上懸掛著歡迎的橫幅。
【美國英語 】 傑出的，第一流的 [B]
This has been a banner year in sales.

title: herald
sections: In England the cuckoo is the herald of Spring.
在英國杜鵑鳥預示春天的來臨。
His rise to power heralded the end of the liberal era.
他的掌權預示著自由主義時代的結束。

title: cloak
sections: The girl wore a red cloak.
那姑娘穿著一件紅色斗篷。
The invaders attacked under a cloak of fog.
侵略者在霧色的掩護下發起了進攻。
His friendly behavior was a cloak for his evil intentions.
他的友善的行為是他險惡用心的偽裝。
使披上斗篷；用斗篷覆蓋
The magician was cloaked in black silk.
魔術師的身上罩著黑絲斗篷。
He cloaked his evil purpose under friendly words.
他用友好的語言來掩蓋他罪惡的目的。

title: reef
sections: Beyond the coral reef the open sea was dark blue.
珊瑚礁之外的大海是一片深藍色。

title: loiter
sections: We must not loiter or we will be late for school.
我們不能閒逛，否則會遲到。

title: inhale
sections: 【美國英語 】【口語】 猛吃；猛喝
He inhaled ten apples at once.
他一下子吃了十顆蘋果。
He lit his cigarette and inhaled deeply.
他點燃香菸，深深吸了一口。

title: susceptible
sections: We are all susceptible to advertising.
我們都容易受廣告的影響。
She is rather susceptible to colds.
This agreement is not susceptible to alteration.

title: repulse
sections: He was repulsed by what he saw.
他對自己所見的感到厭惡。
她的拒絕是完全出人意料的。

title: saucer
sections: She offered me tea in her best cup and saucer.
她用她最好的茶杯和茶碟請我用茶。

title: canvass
sections: They canvassed voters for the Republicans.
他們遊說選民投共和黨人的票。
He canvassed the district for votes.
遊說以贏得（或徵求、徵訂等）
I canvassed the views of our members about the suggestions.
我徵詢會員們對建議的看法。
The city council canvassed the plan thoroughly.
市議會詳細討論了那個計畫。
進行遊說；拉選票；兜攬生意 [（+for）]
I am canvassing for the magazine tonight.
今晚我要去為雜誌徵求訂戶。
The candidates canvassed right up to election day.
候選人們直到選舉日之前一直在遊說拉票。
During a canvass of the neighborhood we collected 200 dollars for the school.
在鄰近地區的一次募捐活動中，我們為學校募得了二百美元。

title: oblivion
sections: Many ancient cities have long since passed into oblivion.
許多古代的城市早已淹沒。
我又什麼都感覺不到了。

title: tart
sections: These apples are a bit tart.

title: chafe
sections: Her shoes chafed the skin on her feet.
鞋子把她的腳上的皮擦傷了。
He chafed his shoes on the rocks.
他在岩石上磨壞了鞋子。
The horse chafed against his stall.

title: jest
sections: 他們說的俏皮話逗得大家哈哈大笑。
I only said it in jest.
我不過是開玩笑說說的。
千萬不要就嚴肅的事開玩笑。

title: scrawl
sections: His signature was an illegible scrawl.
他的簽名潦草難以辨認。

title: cascade
sections: (陡峭的) 小瀑布；(階梯狀) 瀑布的一支
The river fell in a series of cascades down towards the lake.
河形成階梯狀瀑布瀉入湖中。
瀑布狀的東西；一連串的東西
Her hair fell over her shoulders in a cascade of curls.
她的頭髮鬈曲著披垂在肩上。
His money cascaded away in a couple of years.
他的錢在三兩年內便滾滾流失了。

title: betroth
sections: He betrothed his daughter to a doctor.
他把女兒許配給一位醫生。

title: chronicle
sections: 把……載入編年史；記錄；記述
chronicle the growth of a town
記載某個城鎮的發展史

title: slam
sections: 猛地關上；啪嗒一聲關上
His neighbor slammed the door in his face.
他的鄰居當著他的面把門砰然關閉。
She slammed the book on the table.
她將書使勁往桌上一扔。
His habit of slamming friends made him unpopular.
他那苛刻指摘朋友的習慣使得他不得人心。
發出砰然聲；啪嗒一聲關閉
猛闖；猛撞；勢頭很猛地進行
The football players slammed into each other.
He threw his books down with a slam.
他砰然一聲將書摔在桌上。
【美國英語 】【口語】 猛烈的抨擊 [C]
對於你的謾罵我真受夠了。

title: judicial
sections: 法官的；法庭的；法院判定的
評判的；公正明斷的；公平的
A judicial mind considers both sides of a dispute fairly before making a decision.
公正的人總是不帶偏見地考慮發生爭執的雙方的意見，然後才作出決定。

title: vest
sections: 【美國英語 】 背心；馬甲；防護背心
The policeman survived because of his bulletproof vest.
警察因穿有防彈背心而倖免於難。
The management of the foundation is vested in a board of trustees.
基金會的管理交由理事會負責。
The executive power shall be vested in a President of the United States of America.
行政權必須給予美國總統。
The estate vested in the wife of the deceased.
這財產屬於死者的妻子。

title: constellation
sections: a constellation of the most famous television performers of the year
一群本年度最有名的電視演員

title: scour
sections: She scoured the silver in the dining hall.
她將餐廳內的銀製器皿擦得雪亮。
The boy scoured off the dirt from the floor.
男孩擦去地板上的汙物。
The river had scoured out a passage in the sand.
這條河在沙土中沖出一條水道。
This rusted pan does not scour easily.
這只生鏽的鍋不容易擦乾淨。
I gave the dirty floor a good scour.
我把髒地板好好擦了一下。

title: hog
sections: 豬；【美國英語 】 長大的食用豬；【英國英語 】 閹過的肉用公豬
The guy hogged the whole park bench.
那個人佔著整張公園長椅。

title: sagacious
sections: 睿智的；有遠見的；聰慧的
He is the most sagacious member of the committee.
他是委員會裡最富洞察力的成員。

title: mound
sections: There's a mound of books on my desk.

title: shrub
sections: Shrubs are much like trees, but are smaller and more profusely branched.
灌木很像樹，但小得多，且岔枝叢生。

title: purify
sections: purify one's spirit of evil thoughts
淨化某人滿腹邪念的靈魂

title: grove
sections: I used to take a walk in the quiet grove.
過去我常在那安靜的小樹林裡散步。

title: snarl
sections: The dog snarled at the stranger.
The mad man snarled at the children.
"Let me alone," I snarled. "別管我，"我咆哮著說。
At the seaside we could hear the snarl of the waves.
在海濱我們可以聽見波濤的咆哮。

title: crimson
sections: Maggie felt embarrassed and turned crimson.
瑪姬感到很窘，接著臉色變得通紅。
His face crimsoned when he saw her.
他一看到她就滿臉通紅。

title: clam
sections: Everybody shuts up like a clam as soon as you mention it.
你一提及此事，大家便都閉口不言。
沉默寡言的人，守口如瓶的人 [C]
The movie star is a clam about her age.
這影星對她的年齡守口如瓶。
They go clamming every weekend in the summer.
他們夏天每個週末都去挖蛤蜊。
She clammed up when people mentioned her son.
人們一提起他兒子，她就三緘其口。

title: epigram
sections: "I can resist everything except temptation" is a very interesting epigram. "除了誘惑我什麼都能夠抵制"是句非常有趣的雋語。
The audience was amused by his speech full of epigrams.
聽眾被他充滿機智短詩的演講迷住了。

title: shovel
sections: He was working with a shovel.
It didn't take them long to shovel a path through the snow.
他們沒有花很多時間就在雪地裡鏟出一條路來。
They were shoveling coal into a cart.
他們在把煤鏟進手推車。
He shovelled the food into his mouth.

title: thorn
sections: 玫瑰多刺。（有快樂就有痛苦）
Thorns sprang up and choked the wheat.
荊棘叢生，把小麥都蓋沒了。
The biggest thorn in the Prime Minister's side is inflation.
最使首相苦惱的問題是通貨膨脹。

title: rogue
sections: Don't buy a used car from that rogue.
不要從那惡棍手裡買舊車。
The little rogue has his grandpa's glasses on.
這個小淘氣鬼戴上了他爺爺的眼鏡。

title: seethe
sections: The country was seething with political unrest.

title: eclipse
sections: There will be a total eclipse of the sun next Monday.
這條消息使其他一切都顯得無足輕重了。

title: sediment
sections: She scooped out the yeasty sediments.
她將發酵的沉澱物舀了出來。

title: chivalry
sections: 騎士風度；對婦女的殷勤體貼（或彬彬有禮）
He had a sort of instinctive chivalry in him.
在他身上有一種天生的騎士風度。
